subject: Re: [junit] Time Testing
msgSnippet: ... Did you read this? http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com
messageBody:
Harbir Singh Hundal wrote:
>
> I am testing the webrrowser using Junit, and the test
> is running fine, I am using the elclipse IDE.
> now i was to run a test to check the time and load of
> the test using JunitPerf, and i am new to Junit and
> to JunitPerf, therfore i am finding it a bit tough to
> analyze how t do it.
> do i need to put the JunitPerf code in existing
> TestCase class or do i need to create a new suite.
>
> Any Kind of help will be appreciated.

Did you read this?

http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
